intro: Hieracium acradenium, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and slender, hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium acradenium is generally considered a perennial herb, with a fibrous root system that helps it thrive in various soil types.
